title: VLC source, add directory ignores uppercase extensions [windows]

labels.name: Confirmed
labels.description: This bug report has been confirmed by project members

body:
## Platform
<!-- Please fill out the following information about your bug report. -->
<!-- If you are on Linux and installed using a package, please list the package type. -->
Operating system and version: Windows 10 Pro v2004
OBS Studio version: 26.0.0  64bit

## Expected Behavior
VLC source,  'add directory'  would add all valid media files.

## Current Behavior
Files with an uppercase .MP4 extension are silently ignored. I haven't tested other extensions.

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant. -->
<!--- Screenshots and video are encouraged if applicable. -->
1. Name a file: test.MP4 and put it in a new directory.
2. Add that directory to a VLC source.

## Additional information
<!--- Not obligatory, but provide any additional details or information -->
<!--- that you feel might be relevant to the issue -->
The 'add files' option handles these files without issue, but I'm regularly adding new files into the directory so it's desirable to have them picked up automatically.

The site I use to list and download xbox clips sets an uppercase extension for some reason, I wouldn't have run into this otherwise.
